means: （动物的）龇牙低吼，愤怒叫嚷（声）

sentence.Network_en: With a snarl, the second dog made a dive for his heel.
sentence.Network_cn: 伴着一声嗥叫，第二只狗扑向了他的脚后跟。

sentence.Network_en: She was tangled in a snarl of logs and branches.
sentence.Network_cn: 她被困在一堆乱七八糟的木料和树枝中间。

sentence.Network_en: "Aubrey." Hyde seemed almost to snarl the name.
sentence.Network_cn: “奥伯里，”海德几乎是吼出了这个名字。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 变形金刚赛博坦传奇中有什么人物_百度知道 ... Backstop 捕手 Snarl 咆哮 Overhaul 检修.
求WOW命令大全~_爱问知识人 ... /Smile( 微笑) /Snarl( 怒骂) /Sniff( 吸气).
松松：3天背完GRE难词 ... fetter vt. 束缚, 加脚镣 25。 snarl vt. 使缠结, 搞乱, 咆哮着说 26。 mire v. 陷入 27。.
石油英语词汇(S4)--石油百科 ... snapshot 激发快拍 snarl 缠结 snatch block 开口滑车.

list.abs: the accident snarled up traffic for hours ., 事故使交通堵塞数小时.
traffic snarls of a big city ., 大城市的交通混乱.
widening the existing roads can solve traffic snarls on some level .拓宽现有道路，可以一定程度上解决交通挤塞。
make a snarling noise or move with a snarling noise ., 发出吼叫的声音或者带着吼叫的声音移动.
4. snarlssnarling test 打结试验snatch 抢

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: extension of obsolete snar, of Germanic origin; related to German schnarren 'rattle, snarl', probably imitative
late Middle English (in the senses 'snare, noose' and 'catch in a snare'): from snare

entry.def: When an animal snarls, it makes a fierce, rough sound in its throat while showing its teeth.

example.ex: He raced ahead up into the bush, barking and snarling...
example.tran: 它嗥叫着冲向前，一头钻进了灌木丛。

example.ex: The dogs snarled at the intruders.
example.tran: 那些狗冲着闯入者狂吠不已。

entry.tran: 厉声说;吼叫着说;怒气冲冲地说
entry.def: If you snarl something, you say it in a fierce, angry way.

example.tran: 他气急败坏地喊道：“放开我。”

example.ex: I vaguely remember snarling at someone who stepped on my foot...
example.tran: 我隐约记得我曾向着那个踩了我一脚的人怒吼。

entry.def: A snarl is a disorganized mass of things.

example.ex: She was tangled in a snarl of logs and branches.
example.tran: 她被困在一堆乱七八糟的木料和树枝中间。

example.ex: A radio-link automatically advises it of traffic snarls and plots a detour.
example.tran: 一个无线电接入装置会自动通知交通拥堵状况，并给出绕行建议。

means.word_mean: 1. utter in an angry, sharp, or abrupt tone;

sentences.sentence: "The sales clerky snapped a reply at the angry customer"

means.word_mean: 2. make a snarling noise or move with a snarling noise;
3. twist together or entwine into a confusing mass;
4. make more complicated or confused through entanglements

auth_sentence.content: Representative Thaddeus Stevens would not snarl You fatuous nincompoop!
auth_sentence.res_content: Representative Thaddeus Stevens would not snarl You fatuous nincompoop!
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Representative Thaddeus Stevens would not snarl You fatuous nincompoop!

auth_sentence.content: Frustrated drivers, nose to tail in the daily snarl-up.
auth_sentence.res_content: Frustrated drivers, nose to tail in the daily snarl-up.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Frustrated drivers, nose to tail in the daily snarl-up.

sentences.en: The dog gave a low snarl.
sentences.cn: 这只狗发出低沉的吠声。

means.word_mean: 愤怒叫嚷（声）；咆哮（声）；疼痛叫声；纠缠

sentences.en: My knitting was in a terrible snarl.
sentences.cn: 我织的东西都缠在一起了。

means.word_mean: 咆哮着说; 气急败坏地说(~ sth at sb)

sentences.en: She snarled abuse at anyone who happened to walk past.
sentences.cn: 谁碰巧走过,她就冲谁叫骂.

jushi.english: The dog gave a low snarl.
jushi.chinese: 这只狗发出低沉的吠声。

jushi.english: An old drunk was snarling at passers-by in the street.
jushi.chinese: 一个老酒鬼正在街上向行人吼叫。
